text: Cool.
author: William Fiuza

text:
This was the Mario game that would change the course of Mario games forever.

The leap from Mario bros 1 and 2 to the third was just mind blowing on so many levels.

As much as i love 3d mario games, 2d mario games will always hold a special place in my heart.
author: RMJ1984

text: I always figured this would be the ending song at VGM10000 when SupraDarky finally decides to retire at 80 y.o. and stop posting on this channel. But SD knows he's eternal and will never stop posting, so might as well post it now. :-p

text: What a game with classic memorable music :-)

text: This is my favorite game of all time.

text: I cry everytime :,-(

text: Do you think you'd enjoy playing Mario Maker?
author: Rocket Ken

text:
"One of those raregames that are just as fun as when they released, timeless."

So true. SMB3 could be released in 2015 and I'm positive people would still love it. Great design is timeless.
author: drunyon214

text: Such a beautiful tune
author: Azure Alufei

text: I never really noticed before, but a lot of SMB3s music has kinda of a carribean beat to it. Am I wrong?
author: MCHellshit

text: This has always been one of my favorite ending themes, and one of my favorite songs in general. I always make it a point to play this masterpiece at least once a year.
author: Haley S.

text: Best game I've ever played in my life. Every year, I turn on my NES at least 5 times per year to finish this game.
author: Atomikko

text: Not positive but I think this might be the first time I've heard the NES version of this theme; I've (almost?) always heard the SNES version via the Mario All-Stars compilation.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: I remember hearing this song a lot in the Mario 3 cartoon long before I beat the game and discovered what it really was.
author: Daytime Sky

text:
This was the first piece of video game music to make me cry, and from then on has always been one of my favorites, if not my absolute favorite from the Mario series.

This song is so happy, yet so sad, as if the careless years of playing video games are behind you.

Long story short I would want this played at my funeral.
author: Sean Patrick

text: I absolutely love this ending theme.  It's a fitting ending for such a classic game.  I also think this is Kondo's best soundtrack for any of the NES Mario games.  I also think that this game was revolutionary for it's time and set up the release for Super Mario World, the greatest 2D Mario game, perfectly.
author: Eric C.

text:
おお！　これもう一回聞きたかったんよ！
何年ぶりかな・・・２５年ぶりくらいかな。あの頃まだ中学生だったわ・・・。
マリオ３はバッテリーバックアップが付いてなかったから、
１回でクリアしないといけないんで、ちょっと大変なんよね。
author: 懐かしのゲーム音楽

text: For some reason, most of the song reminds of the song that plays inside of the shops in Legend of Zelda Ocarina of time and Majoras Mask,
author: Lincoln Beckett-Scott

text: @Rakeem Beckett-Scott There's a good reason, I think they share some melodies.
author: Catseman

text: @Rakeem Beckett-Scott And obviously both Mr. Koji Kondo

text: @Rakeem Beckett-Scott Both melodies are based on a certain Mexican style of music - I´m not sure what that style might be called, specifically.
author: steaktastebetterpill

text: Like a lullaby, then, boom, to a tropical-beach like theme.
author: WallStaple

text: Always bittersweet to reach the ending of game you had so much fun with, especially when it's a 2D platformer masterpiece like SMB3. One of those raregames that are just as fun as when they released, timeless.
author: SupraDarky
